case.state: All this, just to see me in a state of undress? I'll choose to be flattered -- I'm feeling generous today.
I suppose I can take some time out of my busy schedule to grace you all with my presence.
Sets name to "Lady Yae"
Did the Yashiro Commission girl grow a few inches and dye her hair?
It's a pleasure to see you again, Ganyu. Had I known I'd encounter you here, I'd have brought some Sea Ganoderma for you.
That name... the princess from that fairy tale book series? How intriguing...
A lady of Mondstadt, I presume? And by the armor, a Knight of Favonius, too. An opportunity for foreign outreach falls into my lap. Delightful.
Hello there, miss. Mondstadt has no youkai, so your ears must be due to your bloodline, yes?
My, aren't we an adorable young lady? A member of the Favonius Church, I presume?
I know a potential customer when I see one. You with the purple hair -- you read a lot of books, no?
...Are the ley lines acting up again? Something's... off with this one.
A princess, hmm? Oh, this should be fun.
Those eyes have seen much and more. I'm sure I could get a dozen or so novels out of him, should he share his past.
A new recruit for the shrine? Now's not the best time for a job interview, but I'll keep her in mind.
Energy surrounds this one, in more ways than one. Our interests are likely to align.
The Kujou clan girl's long-lost twin, it would seem. So long as she doesn't pester me with questions, I can tolerate her.
Confidence in oneself is a positive, but I do hope it has a basis in something.
A danger to herself and everyone around her. Seems a high-risk, high-reward venture.
A representative of a competing shrine? I can't let that stand.
I fear we may have some confusion between myself and the other similarly-named guest here. Calling me "Lady Yae" should avoid any misunderstandings, no?
Oh, another visitor blessed with the name "Miko"? I don't suppose you all would mind addressing me as "Lady Yae" to avoid confusion, no?
My, I didn't expect to meet someone sharing my clan's name here. I suppose letting you all address me as "Lady Miko" would keep things clear, hmm?
It's not every day that I meet someone with my surname. I'll be forgiving and let you all address me as "Lady Miko" to avoid confusion. Am I not generous?
Tsk, tsk. So many people eager to appropriate my name. I may be distinguished, but this a bit much.
The common folk naming their children after me would be only an honor if not for the inconvenience. Try not to get us mixed up, will you?
That's very sweet of you, dear, but I'm well aware of what this little game entails. I can't speak for anyone else, though.
Did you prepare all this for me? So thoughtful -- I hope you remembered the fried tofu.
A spread for my birthday, how splendid. The Tri-Commission should make the day of my birth an official holiday, don't you think?
Changing one's form into a butterfly... How whimsical.
I hope we're all well aware that butterflies don't normally talk... A being able to change their form, perhaps?
I've been waiting for you a long time, little one. I'll give the orders, and you'll follow them. That's how you prefer it, hmm?
I hear you're one of my biggest fans, little one. You have my thanks for making it possible for me to be here.
You prefer the chuunibyou girl from Mondstadt and the funeral director from Liyue to me, little one? My my, I'll have to show you the error of your ways.
I'm sure the Tri-Commission would have great use for a skilled engineer such as yourself. I'm afraid I don't have a green-haired princess to accompany you, though.
I know a gunslinger such as yourself has much on his mind, but do try to remember that our Archon is the Raiden Shogun, not the "Raider" Shogun.
You have my thanks for allowing me to be here. I hope you put the 52,000 points to good use.
Were the 52,000 points not enough? Do you need your hair ruffled approvingly as well?
So small... Is this one of those Aranara from Sumeru?
Let me set some realistic expectations right away, young man: I don't have one, and I never will.
Had I any "cat-boys" to introduce you to, I would, but I can acquaint you with youkai girl who takes a cat form. I believe she's busy with deliveries at the moment...
Tell me, when is Gorou coming? I could surely get my fill of entertainment with him here, fufu~
For all her faults, I wouldn't call Ei an idiot. You must have a low opinion of this blue-haired goddess to disparage her so.
I see you've taken a break from making 10,000 characters per day to test me out. How thoughtful.
How many more Vision-holders will you bring here, hmm? I hear you have lofty goals.
Don't worry, little one. What I lack in muscle, I make up for in mommy.
An onsen? How delightful. I'm a regular at the Royal Hot Springs in Tenshukaku -- let's see how this one compares.
I'd expected to have to explain a few things to my opponents, but I didn't think we'd be making it official.
Hmm... I don't see any of our titles on the shelves here. I'll need to speak to the librarian to correct that oversight.
We're in the Court of Fontaine, if I'm not mistaken? The architectural style certainly matches.
...Is there no better location we could find? This is no place for a lady to disrobe.
Seems we're about to mix work and play in a more literal sense.
Keep an eye out for nobushi -- banditry has been constant nuisance since the war started.
It's just like taking a walk through Chinju Forest -- will any youkai be brave enough to show themselves?
These showers had better be off completely. I don't want to get my fur wet -- it takes so long to get dry again.
Quite a different design from Ei's throne room, but no less prestigious. An interesting venue for a game like this, no?
I've heard of this before -- an artificial body of water just for swimming. There's plenty of beaches in Inazuma -- most get their swimming fix there.
Non-sentient kitsune might be tempted to go digging around in the snow out there, looking for food. I know the best place to look is the pantry over there.
I was under the impression that "grabbing your weapon" in this game was more of a metaphor. Was I mistaken?
Are drinks being served? I'll take your finest sake.
This beach is lovely, but doesn't feel complete without the maelstrom above Seirai Island in the distance.
Inazuman gardens usually lack the straight lines so present in the layout of this one, but the orderliness they convey has its charm.
I suppose we need not worry about our lost items being stolen during the game if we have lockers available. An odd choice of venue, regardless.
The lake back there is clearly free of Electro, so it's already safer than many bodies of water I can think of.
You put in significant effort to appear quirky and eccentric, dear. I'm surprised your pseudonym isn't "Penguin of Doom".
Such enthusiasm and earnestness. I do believe you could live up to your moniker. Just don't try to sell me VaultTec products.
Is my bosom not ample enough for you, dear? Unrealistic expectations are born from faulty information. Learn about me directly from the source next time, won't you?
It's okay to be infatuated with me, dear. If we're being honest, who isn't?
"Dark Matter"? What's so dark about it?
I found a small flaw in the dirt-throwing girl's model. You'll have to start from scratch, I'm afraid.
Where is this much-adored pasta girl? She won't come here unless you invite her, dear.
I hear you're an admirer of the "girlfailure" archetype. Suffice to say, I am quite the opposite.
How kind of you to take a break from husbandry of those "pocket monsters" and play a game here.
Some people "see stars" after a head injury in a brawl. Is that what you're obsessed with?
When making that hyper-accurate Sniper model, did you ever take a break from thinking about how you could and ponder if you should?
Yes, dear. We all know you made Giygas. You don't need to remind us every week.
Have I discovered a meeting of Archons? I'm afraid I don't recognize any of you.
...We are on the lookout for new talent at the shrine. Have any of you considered a career as a shrine maiden?
I am Yae Miko, Guuji of the Grand Narukami Shrine. A pleasure to make your acquaintance.
Guuji Yae of the Grand Narukami Shrine. Don't be too intimidated now -- it's less fun that way.
These will serve.
Swap my cards? I couldn't possibly.
This one does not bear good fortune. Replace it.
Hang this one off the fortune slip hangar, or just reshuffle it.
One new card will do. Take this one.
Give me one new one. Yes, now.
Dreadful. I'll need a fresh set.
All of these are lacking in value. I'll need five more.
It's almost impressive how they all managed to be useless. A new hand, please.
Just kidding!
I'm only kidding, of course.
~Cards.text~.
I'll need ~cards.text~.
Be a dear and hand me ~cards.text~.
~Cards.text~, with haste.
I require ~cards.text~.
Fontaine has a saying about "rolling out the red carpet". It seem applicable here.
I could get accustomed to this.
I see someone here knows the principles of good hospitality.
Wonderful.
Exquisite.
Yes, I believe these will do just fine.
It seems I will be an observer this round. That suits me perfectly.
Simply divine.
Most agreeable.
Resistance is futile.
Guaranteed success; my favorite kind.
~Player~, be a dear and prepare some green tea for me, will you? And for yourself and the others, I suppose.
Ah, most auspicious.
I wonder, is someone hoping to earn my favor?
Congenial.
I must be blessed with beauty, wit, and luck.
A heavenly arrangement.
It's well known in Inazuma to not cross the Guuji. I can demonstrate why.
A satisfactory outcome.
Perhaps this little match will meet my standards.
A fair warning to anyone using strategies outside the rules against me: don't.
I'm always watching.
A few hundred years of experience lends one towards ideal outcomes in contests.
Fabulous. Almost as fabulous as me.
Flattery will get you somewhere with me, should I perceive it as sufficiently genuine.
Perfect. How appropriate for yours truly.
The smell of a freshly printed book straight off the presses... It truly makes all the work worthwhile.
The Sacred Sakura blesses all pious souls.
My, to think I'd anticipated some amount of challenge.
No need for me to undress anyone with my eyes; they'll do it themselves soon enough.
Is quality time with the Guuji really worth the risk of humiliating failure? ...Yes, of course it is.
Almost as excellent as your truly.
A win is a win, even if it comes easily.
Nearly as superb as myself.
Marvelous. Simply marvelous.
Fantastic. A hand worthy of the Archon's favorite.
An exceptional arrangement, for an exceptional lady.
Forgettable.
Boring.
What a disappointment.
Less than ideal, but not terrible. In short, tedious.
How uninspired.
Painfully average.
Enough to make one weary.
I don't care for such uncertainty.
I enjoy games of cards, but I prefer having something to work with.
A manuscript I reviewed yesterday was both good and original. However, the part that was good was not original, and the part that was original was not good.
Oh? A challenge? I accept.
I am blessed with near perfect recall of everything I've seen or heard. It comes in very handy, though I have come to learn that some things are best forgotten.
Hardly suitable for one such as myself.
...Really? That's all?
A certain someone I know would call these "pathetic". I'd merely call them dull.
~Player~, be a dear and wake me when this round's over. There's nothing to get excited about with these.
My, my. Aren't games of cards supposed to hold one's interest?
Games of chance may seem at odds with eternity to some, but it's never been an issue in Inazuma. Seems Ei thinks otherwise.
Dreadfully pedestrian.
Unremarkable.
...Goodness, I feel a nap coming on.
Even attempts to sabotage me fail in their execution.
Very funny, but when do I get my real hand?
Dull.
Drab.
Ponderous.
Are only leaden hands to be found here?
Tragic, there was a chance of a noteworthy hand being dealt.
For once, I don't know where this is heading.
Seems we have a close round on our hands.
Stale.
Don't take my observations too hard. I am only cruel to be kind.
Perhaps this can be a learning experience for you all. Despite this middling luck, I am still at the summit of personal achievement.
Standing for so long can't be good for anyone's well-being. Are there no tea cushions for us to sit on?
Is this how VIPs are treated? Surely you can do better.
Reading another bland manuscript is looking fairly appealing now.
It seems one of you will have the honor of taking the fall for me.
Come now, what is a lady supposed to do with these?
Oh, have I reached a moment of difficulty?
Remind me to not get a fortune slip today.
Oh, a challenge? I shan't retreat from that.
Dear me, I might have to put some effort into this.
Only notable for its poor quality.
Unacceptable. I will require recompense.
These need extensive revision.
I don't feel like losing this round. One of you, be a dear and throw for me, will you?
Come now, I'm the one who uses trickery to win. Bad hands don't suit me.
I'm afraid that these simply won't do. Make sure they're better next time.
"Inferior." That's what she would say.
Rather wanting. I must hope for our Archon's blessing.
I will need to pay mind to this round, it seems.
What was it the little Divine Priestess said? "No plan of action survives contact with the enemy"?
Inadequate. I will have to make do.
Substandard. I can only rely on my skill.
A subpar assemblage.
Proofreading is so dreadfully dull. Good thing I have people for that now.
Perhaps someone wishes to see the Lady Guuji at her most vulnerable.
Odious, and at the worst time.
...Is that all? Come now, I might get concerned at this rate.
Insufficient, but manageable.
There's no point in feeling down about a loss born from pure chance.
Victory is still possible when at a severe disadvantage. Watch and learn.
My, how unfortunate. Ah, well; it only makes my eventual win all the more impressive.
...Did I break a comb recently?
Perhaps I should check the straps on my geta when I return.
I must remind the shrine maidens to shoo away any crows that loiter around.
I offer a reward for anyone who sacrifices themselves for me this round--a lock of my hair.
You brought some "motivational" material for later, hmm? One would think you'd find all the inspiration you'd need from your opponents, especially me.
Really, dear? Smuggling in lewd images to this game? Seems a bit redundant, no?
It's too late, dear. I've already memorized it. Carrying around risque images is rather dangerous, no?
I'm tired of this. You should keep duplicates of a Kamera photo so valuable to you, dear.
In the future, make copies of your precious photo. That way, I don't need to listen to you whine about it.
Since you were so kind as to provide a preview of your nude form, I'll let it slide.
That's a creative interpretation of the rules. I think I'll withhold any objection - that was an enjoyable sneak peak at your appearance in defeat.
Something was off about your scent; now it all makes sense. The work of the adepti, perhaps?
I have heard of Liyue's adept being able to do create such beings. How fortuitous to meet one.
Time apart makes the heart grow fonder.
A princess would also not use Dendro to cheat, yet here we are.
I also thought a princess isn't supposed to cheat with Dendro.
Able to manipulate Anemo, yet not carrying a Vision... Interesting. One of the Traveler's kin?
~Player~, be a dear and fetch me some fried tofu -- I'm feeling a bit peckish.
...Where is the tofu, little one? If they don't serve it, go and make some. I'm sure you're capable.
Oh, the look on your face was perfect. If only I'd had a Kamera to capture it.
That was a delectable reaction, dear. A shame it only lasted a few moments.
If you're hoping to keep my interest, don't keep clammed up about where you're from or what you do. A diverse place such as this is perfect for my needs.
Do me a favor, dears, and tell me about yourselves -- the interesting parts, at least. A cosmopolitan establishment such as this is exactly what I was looking for.
Oh, it appears it's my turn again. Aren't you all fortunate?
Alas, it falls to me this round. Try to contain your excitement.
For all my talk of stories, I haven't written any myself.
As much I focus on fiction, I'm not one who creates stories myself.
The march of time has consumed so much knowledge. It's a great struggle to preserve it.
As time goes on, even great beings like gods die, and their knowledge and stories with them. Keeping such information accessible is dreadfully hard.
Finally, you've managed to best me. It's no fun if there's no challenge to be found.
And so, the odds even a bit. It's more exciting if it's anyone's game, regardless.
Don't all stare at once. It's quite unbecoming.
And yet, despite all that, you're still trailing behind me.
Aren't you all so fortunate that the cards didn't favor me? Best grab a fortune slip before your luck runs out.
Time to join the fun again. Watch and learn how a lady behaves when handling a setback.
If you have suggestions on what I should take off next, you're free to share them so that I may ignore them.
Oh my, how heartless. It would be a shame if Her Excellency were to hear about how poorly her friend was treated here.
Just me battling against the cruel whims of fate. Don't fret, dears. I'm no stranger to disadvantage.
Dear me, you all must see me as a threat to target me so. How unsporting.
Having often served as ambassador for Inazuma, this is a less forgiving reception than I'm accustomed to.
Yae Publishing House is looking to expand its market beyond Inazuma's shores. Do tell--what sorts of stories would readers in other nations like to dive into?
I must ask, while I have the chance: what kinds of novels would readers in other nations wish to read? We're taking steps to sell throughout Teyvat.
Perhaps Inazuma is unfamiliar to many of you; no matter, I'm accustomed to explaining things to poor souls out of the loop.
I can intuit that most of you aren't privy to Inazuman affairs. Don't worry, I have to explain the situation to the uninitiated all the time.
Regardless of how this turns out, it should serve as a breath of fresh air from my responsibilities at the shrine. The view's nice, but it's the same old prayers and rituals.
The destination isn't as important as the journey for me. I'm simply looking for a change of pace from managing the shrine.

You see, I own a publishing house that specializes in fiction for a mass audience. We're in need of new ideas for light novels -- settings, themes, aesthetics, character archetypes -- I'm sure you follow.
New light novels -- innovative ones, anyway -- don't spring out of the ground. I'm on the lookout for ideas to borrow from to give our readers something fresh.
Stories about being transported to another world are all the rage these days. It's quite perfect that I'd find a place with people actually from places beyond Teyvat.
Trends come and go, but the current wave of the "transported to a different world" premise has lasted longer than I'd expected. I'm fortunate to meet people who actually hail from other worlds.
It's quite a commitment to plan out and compose a novel, and I have so much on my plate already. Perhaps one day.
I have duties at the shrine and to Yae Publishing House, so the many, many hours that must be devoted to writing and revising will have to wait for now.
One reason I founded my publishing house was to train and support a generation of wordsmiths qualified to commit such tales and histories to ink.
Skilled writers are key to keeping stories and knowledge of the past and present available for the future. Yae Publishing House exists, in part, to hone this craft.
Why are you still standing there, little one? It's not going to lick itself.
Perhaps you're a bit confused, ~player~. This is the part where you put your face between my legs.
You need not tell me right now -- after the game will be fine. Just take some time to think about it, hmm?
I don't need an answer right away -- I'm sure you have more salacious thoughts on your minds. After the game's decided would be fine.
I serve as the chief priestess of the Grand Narukami Shrine, where Inazumans worship our beloved Archon, the Raiden Shogun. She tries her best to live up to her status.
The Grand Narukami Shrine serves as a place of worship for the Electro Archon, Inazuma's deity. Knowing her personally, of course, makes the contrast rather entertaining.
The Sakoku decree didn't last that long, but I could already notice my writers becoming unoriginal, recycling the same plots and story elements.
If one isn't vigilant, they can start retreading the same ground in their work, with the same characters and plots with a different coat of paint. The Sakoku decree didn't help either.
Honestly, some of the things people want from our Archon: mundane things they could sort out themselves, or grandiose wishes that would turn the world upside down.
It really is disheartening to hear some of the things people pray for: utterly banal problems they could easily solve themselves, or silly things that even an Archon couldn't do.
I doubt my writers' ideas about other worlds are very true to life. It seems every world is full of evil monsters easily slain and young women looking for love.
If what our authors believed was true, every other universe is packed full of malevolent creatures waiting to be vanquished and comely young ladies seeking a boyfriend.
Such stories are lacking in deeper impact, but wish fulfillment prints Mora, and I have little interest in fixing something that doesn't need repair.
I find novels of that genre to be enjoyable but often shallow. However, wish fulfillment sells, and so we keep printing them.
...And, do try to avoid drooling too much. You might stain your shirt.
...Yes, yes, they're a stunning sight, but don't drool on your clothes. It's rather distracting.
Do any of you think you have stories worth remembering? Perhaps today is the day to fix that.
One only has a single chance to live a life worth remembering. Don't miss yours.
Hmmm... Not much of note about you, is there, little one? Well, go on. Here's your chance to change that.
You can handle taking a break from ogling me to remove a garment or two, no?
I've received plenty of your stares -- now I need your clothes.
It's not often you'll get a chance to impress me. I suggest you make the most of it.
Get going, young man.
Come now, take something off.
Well? You are familiar with how your own clothes are removed, yes?
We don't have all day, or at least I don't.
I wonder, will you manage to make this worth my time?
I am paying attention, for now. Please invest the appropriate effort.
Inazuma's pursuit of eternity doesn't involve taking forever to do what one is required to. Remove something.
Don't tell me you were foolish enough to think I'd be that easy to best.
If you must comment on your loss, keep it brief and memorable. Empty talk is not why I'm here.
Oh, look at the disappointment in his eyes. It's almost too much to bear.
Look at that, an opportunity to display your body to me. Some would kill for the chance.
...What are you waiting for? Didn't you come here to show off your manly physique?
I hope you weren't under the mistaken belief that you'd only be watching others get undressed.
Try to keep your wits about you -- many forget them when they get too excited.
Pick something and take it off, quickly. I need you to fetch me some refreshments after.
Don't underestimate me. It's never been a successful strategy.
One shouldn't expect anything less competing against me.
Well now, do you have something to show me?
It seems your luck has fallen off, if it was ever there.
Take something off. You never know, I might take a liking to you. ...Might.
You'll have to take something off now. What an unexpected outcome in a game like this.
It may have been wiser to develop better skills before signing up for a contest like this.
You'll need a higher level of play than that to see what's under my robes.
Oh, were you distracted? I can't imagine what could have caused that.
At least you tried. Many can't even manage that.
Come, let yourself be vulnerable. Or better yet, struggle in vain to not appear so. That's more fun.
Look at that attempt at a brave face. Adorable.
Don't complain -- this is what you wanted, is it not?
Go ahead -- pique my interest.
And now, the price of seeing the Guuji in a state of undress. Everything has a cost, of course.
Hmmm... A pretty face, but does anything lie beneath? Go on, little one. I may find something of interest with you.
Conflict is the core of anything worth paying mind to. Let's see where this goes.
A toast to the happy couple. May they never again be parted.
That's reckless, but it certainly catches my attention.
...Really!?
Goodness, have you lost your sense!?
All well and good, dear, but I don't remember asking.
Oh, sleight of hand? That's always a treat to watch... if the performer is skilled enough.
Don't be shy, dear -- just take something off. The worst thing you can do is be boring.
Don't worry, I don't bite.
Think of this as an opportunity to practice courage.
...Well? Go on, strip for me.
There's no shame in losing to the best.
Think of this as an opportunity to show us how bright you can shine.
No need to delay -- take something off.
Have you something of note to remove?
I'm waiting, and it would be best to not let me stay like that for long.
Is losing really that bad? I'm sure you'll manage to survive this.
To live is to lose, and pick oneself back up again. Now, take something off.
Sometimes you need to remove something you like for a better end product.
I heard the ley lines have been affecting people's clothes in this area -- you should remove yours, just to be safe.
In a game of chess, often pieces must be sacrificed to secure a more advantageous position. Try to find such an angle.
Here comes the recreational hazard.
Look at that, I didn't lose the round. Not too surprising, but still worthy of a little celebration, hmm?
Like rice into the huller.
Don't worry, losing is fun. Or, you losing is fun for me, and that's what's important.
You are paying some mind to your hand, no?
Keep trying. Your losses are more entertaining that way.
I hope you're taking this game seriously. There's far less fun to be had with an unengaged opponent.
No surprise here: winning is my natural state of being. I can't say the same for many people.
Time for our rising action to get a little more intense.
Failing one challenge, a new one presents itself.
Our narrative shifts to you, ~target~. Don't disappoint, now.
Rituals can be dull if there's no joy in them. Try for a little flair, hmm?
Some of my subordinates fear that they might become my next victim if they disappoint me. Who's to say if they're wrong?
It's not too difficult a threshold to amuse me. Most people fail, but that says more about them than me.
You have my interest, but can you obtain my attention?
Well, someone had to lose. The "someone" does tend to lack talent at the game, though.
Go on, before my mind starts to wander.
What a great honor you've been bestowed with -- personal entertainment for Lady Yae. I couldn't possibly interrupt.
Oh my, it seems we have you cornered.
I'm a long-time connoisseur of the female form. Let's see if you hold up.
Make haste and take something off. No one here will harm you, that I can make sure of.
Isn't this little game just delightful? For me, at least.
It may be wise to review the rules if this comes as a surprise. Or have you overestimated your skills?
Worse things have happened to better people. Get it over with.
Our editing room is littered with passages cut to improve stories. Your clothes will serve a similar role here.
Come now, even I lost a couple rounds. It's hardly a disaster.
Losing may make you feel bad, but I'm amused watching others get undressed, and isn't that what really matters?
It's time to please me, dear.
If you're not sure what to pick, I would be willing to choose for you.
Don't fret about which garment preserves your modesty the best. Just remove them all.
Disrobe.
There's a chance you could earn my favor by doffing it all. You should take it, don't you think?
Thanks for the meal.
This may be embarrassing for you, but that's a sacrifice I'm willing to make.
Come on, let's see.
Make haste. I'm in the mood.
Be a dear and show us something special.
Better late than never.
You're just in time to perform for me.
You're a bit behind schedule, dear, but I think you can make it up if you try.
Visual aids are always welcome.
A picture paints a thousand words -- make yours count.
There's currently an opening for someone to rest their head in my lap -- here's your chance.
My appetite is yet to be satiated. Show me more.
Hurry, dear. The party's already begun.
Goodness, you're a little tardy, don't you think?
Don't tease me, dear. You're probably not any good at it.
My my, even I didn't see that coming. Such things don't happen often.
A moment of respite for unfortunate souls.
Let's pray it lands somewhere unpopulated, hmm?
For your sake, it had better not land anywhere near me.
I haven't seen a specter of that kind before. It even has a face.
Don't play with specters, dear, They can be dangerous.
Oh my, don't get too ahead of yourself.
Oh no, if you remove that you'll be practically nude!
One could be forgiven for not noticing you had that on you.
Not everyone is born for the spotlight. ~Target~ is proof of that.
I know my beauty is intimidating, dear, but this is not the time or place to be so reserved.
Tsk, tsk. It may take some practice, but you could learn to be interesting person one day.

Yawn
Excuse me while I practice my chants in my head.
...Disappointing.
Such a bland option. Let's move on before I need a nap.
Congratulations. You were almost in danger of being noteworthy, but you managed to avoid it.
I suppose not every part of an outfit is exciting to see removed. What a shame.
You only have so many chances to receive my attention. Try not to waste anymore, hmm?
Let's move along, shall we? I might die of boredom otherwise.
I now know what eternity really is, having waited for ~target~ to remove ~clothing.ifPlural(those|that)~.
Throwing spirits at people? Fascinating...
Having a ghost familiar attack your foes? I should try that...
Oh? A youkai, here? It must be a small world. Or rather, small multiverse.
My, she's a skittish one.
Best to get ~clothing.ifPlural(those|that)~ out of the way early.
Only ~clothing.ifPlural(those|that)~? Dear me, don't get too out of hand now.
